title: 5 International Egg Recipes
author: Chino Valley Ranchers
content:
If scrambled eggs are no longer hitting the spot, you should consider exploring recipes from around the world. From India and Turkey to Spain and Hawaii, these five egg recipes will add a new kick to your breakfast, lunch, or dinner.


1. Egg Curry

This egg-based take on curry is rich in spices and flavor. The ingredients include vegetable oil, onion, garlic paste, ginger paste, ground coriander, cumin, turmeric, chile powder, ground black pepper, tomato puree, water, vinegar, salt, and hard-boiled Chino Valley Ranchers eggs.


Begin by heating oil in a large pot over medium heat and add onion. After five minutes, stir in garlic, ginger paste, coriander, turmeric, cumin, chili powder, and black pepper. Cook for about one minute and add tomato puree. Pour water into the pot and bring the sauce to a boil. Then stir in vinegar and salt. Drop the eggs into the pot and cook for about five minutes. Serve the curry over a bed of white rice and enjoy!

2. Turkish Style Eggs

Bring a taste of Turkey to your kitchen with this easy-to-make recipe. This dish is made with three garlic cloves, 1 ½ cups plain yogurt, one pinch salt, one-quart water, one tablespoon vinegar, one teaspoon salt, six Chino Valley Ranchers eggs, two tablespoons butter, and one teaspoon paprika.

View the full recipe.


3. Tortilla Espanola

This Spanish dish features onions, potatoes, and eggs, and can be enjoyed any time throughout the day. To make this dish, you’ll need two tablespoons of olive oil, two large potatoes, ¼ teaspoon smoked paprika, one sweet Spanish onion, six Chino Valley Ranchers eggs, one teaspoon of olive oil, one bunch of fresh parsley, salt, and pepper to taste. You’ll need to use an oven and skillet to prepare this Tortilla Espanola.


View the full recipe.


4. Hawaiian Loco Moco

Treat yourself to a Hawaiian comfort food classic made with ground beef, eggs, and rice. This recipe requires ground beef, cayenne pepper, beef stock, soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce, cornstarch, ketchup, white sugar, sesame oil, unsalted butter, minced green onions, Chino Valley Ranchers eggs, and white rice.


View the full recipe.


5. Cajun Fried Egg Sandwich

Dig into this cajun egg sandwich and you’ll never go back to your boring egg sandwich. To make this recipe, you’ll need one tablespoon of butter, one Chino Valley Ranchers egg, one slice of Cheddar cheese, one teaspoon mayonnaise, one teaspoon mustard, one teaspoon ketchup, one pinch of Cajun seasoning, one dash of hot pepper sauce, two slices toasted white bread, one lettuce leaf, and one slice tomato.
